articles.description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has rejected Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's request seeking an exemption until July 7 citing a busy schedule. The agency issued a second summons for Friday to record his statement in a money laundering case

articles.author: Manju V
articles.title: 4 die as chopper headed for oil rig off Mumbai coast lands at sea, goes down
articles.description: Four of the nine occupants of a Pawan Hans helicopter died after the aircraft, carrying ONGC officials to an oil rig in Bombay High, made an emergency landing in the Arabian sea on Tuesday.

articles.author: TNN
articles.title: Plan to ban pets in Cubbon Park on hold
articles.description: The Karnataka government has decided to suspend its proposed ban on pet dogs at Cubbon Park for the time being. It will frame a new set of rules by next week to regulate the entry of pets into the park.

articles.description: The US has already announced investment worth $30 million for a fund promoting food security in India under the PGII which, according to the White House, will deliver "game-changing'' projects to close the infrastructure gap in the developing world.

articles.title: Karnataka issues fresh Covid guidelines
articles.description: According to fresh Covid guidelines issued by the Karnataka, an apartment will be considered a small cluster if there are 3 to 5 cases & symptomatic residents on the floor will be subjected to Rapid Antigen Test.

articles.title: C’durga, Belagavi, Dharwad among best school edu dists
articles.description: Chitradurga, Belagavi and Dharwad from Karnataka are ranked among 'Athi Utham' (very good) districts in the country in school-education performance, says a report released by the ministry of education.

articles.author: Petlee Peter
articles.title: Wedding hall told to refund man Rs 1.9 lakh advance
articles.description: In cases of inability to carry out wedding events at halls or kalyana mantapas due to Covid-19 restrictions, hall/mantapa representatives are liable to refund the advance money paid by customers after deducting 5% as tax, a Bengaluru consumer court ruled.

articles.author: Shreyas HS
articles.title: Pourakarmikas forced to wear torn uniforms
articles.description: Pourakarmikas toiling to keep the city spick and span are being forced to wear torn and worn-out uniforms, allegedly by BBMP contractors and marshals, as the urban local body hasn’t distributed new ones since 2020.

articles.title: Saliva samples to replace blood tests for diabetes - Times of India
articles.description: A saliva sample could soon replace blood tests to diagnose and monitor diabetes, according to a city-based study.

articles.title: Bldg crashes have killed over 800 in Mumbai in 50 years
articles.description: In close to five decades, more than 800 people have lost their lives in building collapses in Mumbai.
